intro: Ptilotus marduguru, commonly known as the red bush willow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its structure includes slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Ptilotus marduguru is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
